types.html:
passé simple m (plural passés simples)

  1. (grammar) past historic tense, a tense used in some languages (such as French and Italian) in narrative, roughly equivalent to the simple past or preterite in English
    • 2023, “French Kiss”, performed by Chilly Gonzales:
      Je comprends que je manque de maîtrise / Mais heureusement, j'assume mes bêtises / Votre passé simple n'est pas si simple
      I understand that I lack control / But fortunately, I take responsibility for my mistakes / Your simple past is not so simple
trans: past historic tense, a tense used in some languages  in narrative, roughly equivalent to the simple past or preterite in English

title: passé simple
pronunHtml: • IPA(key): /pa.se sɛ̃pl/ ~ /pɑ.se sɛ̃pl/
